alert.note: Alert for Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 28 at 5:51PM MDT until May 28 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR ZONE 247...SOUTHERN LINCOLN AND SOUTHEAST ELBERT COUNTIES... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT SUNDAY AFTERNOON FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR ZONE 247...SOUTHERN LINCOLN AND SOUTHEAST ELBERT COUNTIES... * Affected Area...Fire Weather Zone 247. * Timing...Red Flag Warning continues until 8 PM MDT this evening. A Fire Weather Watch is in effect Sunday afternoon. * Winds...West to southwesst 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 7 percent. * Impacts...Any fires that start will be likely to spread rapidly.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.

area.areaDesc: Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County
